page.title: 12 TRANSPORT
page.content: Public transport is at a minimum.A bus service based at Aberystwyth,16 miles away,and called "Crosville" arrives at Swyddffynnon 3 times a week,on Mondays,Wednesdays and Fridays at 10 a.m..The passengers are taken as far as Aberystwyth,and the bus returns at 2.00 p.m..Several people take advantage of this service to do their weekly shopping.Every Tuesday,the Llangeitho bus goes through the village on its way to Tregaron and Lampeter markets every alternate week.It returns at 3.30p.m.A popular means of transport is the "Country Cars",where privately owned cars take passengers to various destinations .This has a distinct advantage over the bus service because it can take people at specific times to their appointments,and return them home immediately.The elderly like this way.
